TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit iPhoneOSGameView extends Xamarin.iOS.dll=UIKit.UIView implements class System.IDisposable, class Xamarin.iOS.dll=OpenTK.INativeWindow, class Xamarin.iOS.dll=OpenTK.Platform.IGameWindow

Docs.summary: Methods to create and managed an OpenGL window.

remarks.para: iPhoneOSGameView provides two (largely unrelated) sets of methods. Specifically, using this class does not require use of the run loop processing methods. The groups are:

item.term: OpenGL context creation and disposal methods: , , , , , and .

remarks.para: All other members are ancillary to the above two major groupings.

block.para: All subclasses must provide a method that provides the class-level layerClass selector (so that CocoaTouch will provide the correct background layer). Consequently, all subclasses must provide the following method (the method name can change, but the must be unchanged, as well as the implementation):

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void CreateFrameBuffer() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates the framebuffer so that OpenGL operations can be performed.

remarks.para:
This method is invoked to create an
implementation, create a , and initialize the GL context so that a framebuffer and renderbuffer exist for future GL calls.
This method is invoked by: , , and .
remarks.block:
This method performs the following operations:
Configure the 's .
is used to set the
property, while
is used to set the property.
is invoked.
The
is created, wihch in turns creates an . The EAGLContext can be retrieved through the
property.
A renderbuffer is created and bound to the GL context as the RenderbufferOes property. The renderbuffer is accessible via via .
is invoked to bind the above renderbuffer to EAGLContext.
A framebuffer is created and bound to the GL context as the FramebufferOes property. The framebuffer is accessible via .
The framebuffer and renderbuffer are bound together: GL.Oes.FramebufferRenderbuffer (All.FramebufferOes, All.ColorAttachment0Oes, All.RenderbufferOes, renderbuffer);
is initialized based on the current value.
GL.Viewport(0, 0, Size.Width, Size.Height) is invoked.
GL.Scissor(0, 0, Size.Width, Size.Height) is invoked.

block.para: Inheritors can override either , or this method to add additional construction logic (e.g. to add a depth buffer). If only the layer needs to be configured, then override ConfigureLayer; otherwise, override this method and call this implementation to create the framebuffer and renderbuffer.

Intelligent OpenGLES fallback can be performed by changing the
if an error occurs. For example:

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnClosed(class System.EventArgs e) cil managed

Docs.param: An that contains the event data.

remarks.para: The OnClosed method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
remarks.block: When overriding OnClosed in a derived class, be sure to call the base class's OnClosed method so that registered delegates receive the event.

Docs.summary: Occurs part of run-loop processing when a frame should be rendered.

remarks.para: When using the run-loop processing architecture, events happen in the following order:

and , invoke
before starting the / loop which is invoked for every rendered frame.

ends the / loop processing, then invokes the
event.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Run() cil managed

remarks.para:
Invokes , raises the
event, then begins run-loop processing. Run-loop processing consists of the following step (which happens for each frame):

item.term: The OpenGL frame buffer is re-bound to .

remarks.para:
Run-loop processing should not be used if a persistant layer is used (i.e.
is ); the entire view should need to be re-rendered on every frame.

In this Run overload, there is no delay between raising of the
event and the
of the following frame; everything is executed as quickly as possible. This may not be desirable.

Docs.exception: The instance has had invoked on it.

Docs.param: A containing the number of frames per second that should be updated and rendered.
Docs.summary: Starts run-loop processing at a rate of frames per second.

remarks.para: If is 0.0, then is invoked and the method exits.

Docs.summary: The size of the current view.
Docs.value: A which is the size of the current view.

remarks.para: This differs from in that Size's Width and Height are of type , while Bound's Width and Height are of type (i.e. integer vs. floating-point). OpenGL uses integral types, so Size is a simple way to get sizes in a form usable by OpenGL.

Docs.exception: The instance has had invoked on it.
